messages: 4e893e132b2405a10eafe65861142f1c (23:36): i'm fighting bugs on ubuntu dapper, is there a dev because i'v a problem
4e893e132b2405a10eafe65861142f1c (23:40): oldskoolPunk, 3ds script is the same as in cvs, but with a cvs compiled blender binaries it worked

76d71d9e9ff081c25d402352be3ec38a (23:41): Is there some good settings for glass material? :)

3804cb57bc9e1a8e534cee3bf15b2e7e (23:43): Hello, I want to make an object follow a curve. I need it to stop in the middle of the curve for a couple of seconds and then continue. What is the correct way to animate this?
d6e61f0fdc57d5496977311585e7a599 (23:45): amitibo: you'll want to look into dupliframes, then you'll need to edit the ipo info to make it stop in the middle
76d71d9e9ff081c25d402352be3ec38a (23:48): The light doesn't get reflected from glass with blender?
76d71d9e9ff081c25d402352be3ec38a (23:49): And the shadows, they seem to be just shadows like the shape, is there a way to get them realistic?
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (23:51): Tokyo: I've found out how to clip an object visually, as long as you don't see the cutout side
03b4d35671b02b3d5b0c33113965796e (23:54): i can't get objects to follow bones
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (23:55): oxi: did you parented the armature with the mesh?
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (23:55): there are 2 ways to deform a mesh, vertex groups and envelopes
03b4d35671b02b3d5b0c33113965796e (23:55): but when i rotate a bone in pose mode the mesh doesnt move
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (23:56): if not, it's not correctly parented
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (23:56): do you have vertex groups defined?
03b4d35671b02b3d5b0c33113965796e (23:56): now how do i move just a single bone?
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (23:57): go to weight paint mode in the mesh
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (23:57): the vertex group corresponding to that bone should be in red
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (23:58): well, should be non-blue, but if it generated vertex groups, it should be in red
03b4d35671b02b3d5b0c33113965796e (23:59): its blue, and after clicking on the bone, it remains blue yet :/
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (23:59): you can also see the existing vertex groups going to edit mode in the mesh, selecting a vertex group from 'link and materials' panel, and pressing select
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (00:00): oxi, then there aren't any vertex groups
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (00:00): clic on the bone, and paint the zone you want to influence with that bone
adaded56792f85185adfeb3d9d210e7c (00:00): also deliuting all vertex groups and set pearents again sometimes helps
aa3cccc87a3aee9d20a880d74b72bff3 (00:01): oxi, yeah, as Tokyo said, if you reparent it, you can select the option 'create vertex groups from closest bones'
03b4d35671b02b3d5b0c33113965796e (00:02): ok but i did that several times and didnt work either... could this be a bug or something?
adaded56792f85185adfeb3d9d210e7c (00:04): realy , it can be a problem , sometimes vertex groups messing up , try to delete ALL of them , and repeat pearenting
03b4d35671b02b3d5b0c33113965796e (00:04): silly question, how do i delete them O:)
adaded56792f85185adfeb3d9d210e7c (00:07): shit , now I'll must sit here and watching render process ... hate that phase
adaded56792f85185adfeb3d9d210e7c (00:09): I would like to find some blender girl ... ( I mean real :)
adaded56792f85185adfeb3d9d210e7c (00:10): btw , the verse project, is it now possible to work with same project in multiuser mode
6bdf4521165fe0d0fae23a0112289d95 (00:24): at least 2 here the way it is  :)
6bdf4521165fe0d0fae23a0112289d95 (00:26): hate trying to figure out lighting w/o overloading it  :(
